definition: to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident

sentences.english: Car crash, broken glass, broke my dreaming.
sentences.chinese: 车辆猛撞了，玻璃尽裂，打碎我的梦。

sentences.english: The car turned over twice,left the road,and ploughed into the wall.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车翻了两下，离开了马路，猛撞到一堵墙上。

sentences.english: He bashed his head against the shelf.
A car crashed into a tree last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚一辆小汽车猛撞到一棵树上。

sentences.english: He battered his head against the stone wall.
The language angel  hanged up the gang and  banged them at the  angle of the  triangle.
sentences.chinese: 语文天使将那伙人吊起朝三角形的角上猛撞。

sentences.english: The language angel hanged up the gang and pushed them towards the outlook of the trioutlook.
sentences.chinese: 发言天使将那伙人吊起朝三角形的角上猛撞。

sentences.english: He kneed his attacker in the groin.
sentences.chinese: 他用膝盖猛撞攻击者的下身。

sentences.english: When push came to shove, Ben Ali pushed back -- hard.
sentences.chinese: 当轻推变成了猛撞，本阿里做出了强硬的反击。

sentences.english: The impact of the crash hurtled the driver against the windshield of the car.
sentences.chinese: 碰撞的震力使驾驶员猛撞于车子的挡风玻璃上。

sentences.english: He crashed his car into a wall.
Large Nike soccer ball was smashed into the side of a building.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的耐克足球猛撞进了一栋建筑的侧面。

sentences.english: She said she couldn'tstand the pathetic spectacle of a man banging his head against an impregnablewall.
sentences.chinese: 她说她不忍心看到一个男人猛撞南墙。

sentences.english: With a despairing cry the woman banged her head against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 随着一声绝望的呼叫，那女人把头往墙上猛撞。

sentences.english: The automobile was hurled into a ditch after crashing into a tree.
sentences.chinese: 汽车猛撞到树上后翻进沟里了。

sentences.english: The force of the blast dashed him against the wall of the cave.
sentences.chinese: 狂风的威力把他猛撞在山洞石壁上。

definition: to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to collide/jerking motion/to impinge/to offend/to provoke
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to knock down/to knock over/to run over (sb)
loud sound, such as that of thunder or a bomb/to rumble/to roar
